snippet: American businesses that wait too long to investigate opportunities in Egypt, Libya and newly liberalized nations could be left behind, some argue.
abstract: Political and economic changes in the Middle East more than a year after the Arab Spring have closed some doors and opened others for business people willing to tolerate risk; some analysts say American businesses that wait too long to investigate opportunities in Egypt, Libya and newly liberalized nations could be left behind.
lead_paragraph: American businesses that wait too long to investigate opportunities in Egypt, Libya and newly liberalized nations could be left behind, some argue.

headline.seo: After the Arab Spring, a Rush to Do Business in the Middle East
headline.main: A Rush to Do Business in the Middle East

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
